instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>/<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> flex gate issue
threads.message:
Is there a way we can identify looking at the pictures which cable is bad on the display assembly? 
Sometimes I get the usual backlight cable damage, Physically visible, Then I normally change the cable (I mean patch another cable with the existing cable). 

Sometimes I don't see any physical damage on the cables, But there will be vertical /horizontal lines on the display... But suffering to figure out the damaged part in such cases

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>/<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> flex gate issue
threads.message:
Not all will fail the same way. However, usually, cable cracks if it is caused by stretching. 
Check this out - [MEDIA=youtube]a2QSHlcMfxw:334[/MEDIA]
